Title: SO nice I bought it TWICE!!
Cons: The lens cap is a little (soft) and pops off too easily (I needed to add another set of springs to keep it on reliably)  I would have loved to have had a little more zoom added to this model ( I think I will be able to live without that).  The body is larger  than the z710,( but I guess I have to allow for more features).  My BIGGEST PROBLEM with the camera is that I can't remove the batteries without removing the camera from a tri-pod.  I am having a VERY hard time learning how to take pictures of the heavens, (maybe I need a little teaching) MY 2nd  largest problem with this camera, is that I can take SOOO many videos, and pictures that I like I have filled up a 200Gig partition on my hard drive.
Pros: Great resolution even in digital zoom.  The image stabilization is a fantastic upgrade to the z710.  I love the fact that they added continuous zoom to the video.  3 photo stitch is a BEAUTIFUL new toy for me to play with,I have a picture of something being held up in 3 places by one person.  I have perfect  pictures with baseballs, broken bats, and stopped chopper blades(NO blur).  the mod dial is still not near the shutter, or zoom so there aren't mistakes.
Comments: You can take many photos so you can get the one you like (want)..  You don't HAVE to have much photo knowledge at all to take great photos.  The insurance plan that I bought was a GREAT NECESSITY.  AND A GREAT thing to buy, I had a problem with my 1st camera, I called newegg and they told  me to send it back.  A new camera was not able to be acquired, so I was given the option of either getting something of similar value, OR a COMPLETE refund.  I bought 2 other brands similar, or upgraded cameras.  After 2 months of trying to find a replacement....I bought a refurbished model.   Buy this camera if you have room for a 35mm sized body body, with similar functions, but don't need to set everything.

Title: Best American camera there is
Cons: Produce grainy picture when zoomed to the max, or under low light condition. This is probably true for all camera though. Manual is very brief. Go to Kodak website for more manual, or read a Canon/Nikon manual. The icons all work the same way. Bottom says designed in Japan, made in China.
Pros: Use American brand, with pride. Good picture quality. Large lens. 1-3/8 inch diameter. 12x optical zoom, beats any compact by several fold. Easy to focus, even when zoomed to max. Flash produces good lighting. Intuitive to use, after reading the 20 page manual. The lens is not changeable like a real SLR. But with 396mm zoom, there is no need to change lens. There is no need to bring a bag of lens. Very cheap for what you get.
Comments: The battery in the package is single use. I got a charger plus 2 Li-Ion rechargeable for $20. Works great. Box says INSTEN KOD 8000 charger 8980. Lens cap is a little annoying to deal with. But it does not impact picture quality.

Title: Love my new camera!
Cons: It does not come with a rechargeable battery. The documentation could be much better--both the book and online versions. As a minor note, if you turn on the camera with the lens cap on, the cap flies off, almost requiring you to attach it to the neck strap.
Pros: Great point-and-click camera with added functionality, such as the ability to adjust shutter speed. Very good zoom and quality HD video for its class. Menu system was easy to learn, because it's very similar to my previous EasyShare v530 camera.
Comments: I just photographed some Tropical Storm Fay flooding, and the pictures turned out great. The video of trees whipping around was also nice.

Title: Amazing
Cons: Manual is Very Basic. The Camera, itself, taught me more. Lense cap was a Surprise, but no biggy.
Pros: Easy to use,  a point and shoot but better. Virtually every shot is Perfect. In camera Croping is Great. Features are endless. 12x zoom is a Godsend.
Comments: Anymore a Camera is SCL (Standard Combat Load) for Me. Moments pass to quickly to miss, and never come again. Don't Leave Home without it, Yes I wrote that, but I wasn't the First

Title: Great Camera
Cons: My biggest gripe is batteries. I like rechargeables and my NI-MH batteries won't work. The Z1012 sees only Kodak propriety battery or non-rechargeable Lithiums. I think that NewEgg should offer a bundled of two KLIC-8000 rechargeables and a recharger at a nice price.
Pros: This the first really serious camera I've owned and am still learning all of the functions. It takes really beautiful pictures outdoors. Some indoor shots are fuzzy and have to be take several times, but when you get it right - WOW! The bundled software from Kodak is neat and easy to use. Definitely recommended buy.

Title: Comprehensive Z1012 Review
Cons:
Very high quality movies, but they're rendered as .mov (not a bad thing) just make sure you have quicktime to view. 
HD mode is nice, but in low light environment despite the mode you're in, you'll have alot of "visual noise" in video to compensate for lack of light (high light situations are amazing though).
HD mode quality is amazing, but the performance feels lacking, I can definitely detect video lag when panning the camera quickly in HD mode.
Needed to buy the lithion battery charger and 2 high powered packs from e.ba.y - (only 20 bucks but still) would have been nice to come with the camera.
Pros:
Great technology - Smart Picture mode is very easy to use - point and shoot
Great features, complete creative control
Zoom is amazing, very fast responsive
Quality is amazing in low light
Some guy said the write speed is slow? He has a buggy external memory card, because my write speed is FAST.
Image stablization - wow, so intuitive helps correct those small hand movements when taking pictures to prevent fuzziness.
As a camera this thing is amazing on all ends. Creativity, quality, technology, and responsiveness.
Feels great on the hand once you learn how to hold it.
Lens cap is awesome - don't forget to take it off when you power on your camera though because the lens extends from the camera, pushing it off.
I suggest P mode which is auto smart picture mode, but with the added capability of changing focus modes (macro/landscape/manual/auto).
Auto red eye remover in P and Auto mode - what more can you ask for?
Comments:
Definitely read the manual - it's straight forward and intuitive.
Ultra quality camera for decent price, I think that's a deal no matter how you slice it.
I wonder how sturdy this thing is though, it's actually a smaller camera than most, no bigger than half the size of the average hand. I feel like if I dropped it, forbid that happening, something would definitely break just because of how it's built. So keep a sturdy hold on the thing :)
Definitely recommended buy.

Title: Perfect Camera
Cons: No cons soo far & I don't believe there will really ever be one.
Pros: The zoom goes far beyond what I could of even imagined(plus very clear for being so far), great image stabilizer, clear & crisp pictures, only takes 2 AA batteries, easy to use, easy to carry.
Comments: I've only had my hands on this camera for an hour now but I know I can already assure you this is the PERFECT camera for someone that is more than just a point & shoot person. I can see that this camera would also be good as maybe a backup camera for a professional.

Title: eh
Cons: kodak in general.  Indoor shots looked faded, no rechargeable battery included
Pros: Takes great outdoor shots.  Cheap for 10MP cam.

Title: I love my new Kodak  :)
Cons: Bit slow coming on, and processing, but I'm not a Pro, so it's fine for me.  Not any real cons I can think of.
Pros: It's like my 5th digicam over the years, and by far the best so far.  Takes awesome, sharp, colorful pictures, even at full zoom.  Panorama feature is great, lots of fun.  Nice balance of preset functions, and manual controls.  Kodak quality is evident.  Very nice looking camera.  Price is very affordable.  Oh, and of course I got it a day early, only 2 days of waiting!  That's what I love about Newegg.
Comments: I saw people complain about the lens cap, I don't see anything wrong with it, has the standard spring clips, stays on the camera just fine.  Somebody said that it only takes 3 pics at a time on burst.  Well, it will also take 30 pics at once on the other burst setting, and even though it only saves the last 3, that pretty much guarantees you will get that action shot, at least in my way of thinking.  People also talked about the battery, that the one that comes with it is only a disposable one, and the rechargeable KLIC8000 is kinda expensive..well I got 2 high capacity KLIC8000 compatibles and a charger online dirt cheap.  This camera is great for the intermediate to slightly advanced user.

Title: Good value
Cons: Macro mode isn't as good as Olyumpus. Needed more file options, particularly uncompressed format like .tiff. Had a peculiar problem converting the Quicktime. Only comes with a proprietary disposable camera battery, rather than the Li-Ion/charger kit common today, will add an extra $35 down the road.
Pros: Quick reaction time, as one should expect from an SLR-like camera. Comfortable grip, allowing the easy taking of stills and action shots. Feels professional. Superb video, excellent image quality.
